item.description:

item.title: Cars parked on bend, 12th September
item.description:
Cars are parking on the bend making it impassible to larger vehicles, my primary concern is that a fire engine would not be able to pass in the event of a fire. This should be addressed with double yellows (or something) on the bend to stop cars parking there.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Thistlefield Close, Albany Park, London

item.title: Filthy corridor. Never cleaned to a satisfactory standard., 12th September
item.description:
Permanently filthy unhygienic squalor. The corridor is permanently filthy. Apparently the floor gets mopped once a month with cold water so it’s never clean properly. I don’t think it’s cleaned every month and also once a month. It’s not good enough.

item.title: Fly Tipping, 12th September
item.description:
Friday is my Green Bin Collection Day. Upon checking my bin this morning, because of an abundance of Flies, I noticed that someone had loaded up my bin with their rubbish, and also left it lying around in the road: tins, bottles, paper, cardboard and food. I opened up one of the bags and found torn up letters with the following name and address on it: Mr Abidemi Agbaje, Flat 1, 13 Elm Grove, Erith Kent DA8 3BL. This individual had also 'done' the same thing to several other residents in the road. Can you please deal with this matter accordingly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park Crescent, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The Chislehurst High St recycling centre bins for plastic and cans are still not being emptied regularly, 12th September
item.description:
• Please give brief details of your complaint or compliment below: The Chislehurst High St recycling centre bins for plastic and cans are still not being emptied regularly. I have reported this previously and was advised that these should be emptied every Wednesday. This is the state of them this morning (Thursday). They have not been emptied for at least 2 if not 3 weeks. We live next to the site and therefore do not have a recycling collection by waste lorry, so only have the site to dispose of this recycling responsibly. • What action (if any) would you like us to take? Empty the bins and continue to do so on a weekly basis • Have you already spoken to somebody in the Council about this matter? yes • If yes, and you know who you spoke to please provide details and dates: Previously submitted complaint answered by email
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Adelaide Road, Chislehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several vans suddenly appeared on our road overnight., 12th September
item.description:
Unknown vans have been parked here for the last 3/4 days. Usually there is suffiecient parking on this stretch of road for family members and visitors but suddenly lots of vans/taxis have appeared. It seems that someone is using our road to park their vehicles but is actually taking up the spaces of residents.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 225, Great Cambridge Road, Southbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet
